metadata.title: CVE-2019-12218 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libSDL2.a in Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL)2.0.9 when used in conjunction with libSDL2_image.a in SDL2_image 2.0.4.There is a NULL pointer dereference in the SDL2_image functionIMG_LoadPCX_RW at IMG_pcx.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1ubuntu0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1').
sdl-image1.2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1ubuntu0.14.04.1~esm1').
